text: I have buried kings and burned prophets. Do not speak to me of fate.
I go where omens point and leave where they bleed.
She walks the way between fate and ruin.
Her advice comes laced with truth and venom.
Those who turn from her words vanish in snow and shadow.
She bears charms that make grown men weep.
She reads what the fire leaves behind.
She made a bargain once — no one knows with whom, or for what.
Wreathed in talismans and curses, she is prophecy given flesh.
Usta sees what others cannot, and says what others dare not.

Usta the Witch is feared in every hall north of Troll Country, for hers is the name whispered when auguries go dark. One of the last true hag-seers of Norsca, she walks alone, wandering from coast to crater, muttering to stones and bones alike. No jarl has ever claimed her, though many have tried — those who pressed too hard now serve as stories told to frighten children. When Einarr Sigdansson saw the end in his dreams, it was Usta he sought. And when she saw his fate, she chose to walk beside it.
Usta plunges a bone needle into the doll, and her enemy howls in shared torment.
What she touched lingers. What she saw, you now fear.
Local Recruitment duration: %+n turn for all Marauder Champion and Huscarl units
